feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically calculates and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for the leave policy type (calendar days or working days) and automatically deducts public holidays from working days. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system creates an automatic pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
To adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave option

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee; the leave policy type (calendar days or working days) must be configured.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays from working days calculations.
Super admin role and access to payroll settings; existing leave types and salary component structure in the system
Access to Leave Settings and ability to add or modify leave policies as a Super Admin
Super admin access to payroll settings; payroll system must be configured

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of public holidays in the month, approved unpaid leave days.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction reflected on the payroll table; calculated daily pay rate for unpaid leave deduction purposes.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method that applies daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request; approve leave request; determine leave policy type (calendar or working days); calculate total working days in the month; subtract public holidays from working days; calculate daily pay rate by dividing salary by actual working days; generate automatic payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations. 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and resave the new proration settings

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days. The leave policy can use either calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month, e.g., 31 for January, 28 for February), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). Only Superadmin, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select the calculation base.

Salary component selection limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection limited to three options: Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Configuration applies to individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected when configuring the policy

Changes to salary proration affect all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working policy, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days, not 22 days.

Calculation results vary depending on the month length when using calendar days, and different calculation methods (calendar days vs. working days vs. custom days) can significantly impact final wage calculations. Companies must ensure their chosen method aligns with applicable labor laws.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration, allowing them to review potential impacts before finalizing settings

Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days), requiring careful selection based on organizational policy
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject existing transactions and resave proration settings to apply changes

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; integrates with leave management system for unpaid leave request approval; connects with employee record systems to access salary information.

The Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service payroll processing
Interacts with the payroll system to apply calculated daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; related to Leave Policies and Leave Settings configuration
Interacts with Payroll system, payroll table transactions, and affects employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days: A leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month). Working days: A leave policy based on working days (e.g., 22 working days per month).

Calendar days: The number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: Only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: A flexible calculation base set by payroll table managers according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law.

Leave encashment: The conversion of unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: Final payroll settlement when an employee exits the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies. Salary components: Basic salary and allowances used in wage calculations.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that does not receive compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily values; Leave Policies: Configuration settings that define how leave is managed; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type based on calendar dates; Working days: Day calculation type based on business working days; Custom days: Day calculation type based on custom-defined days

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): Feature for configuring salary proration calculation bases. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days

markdown_report:
# Zendesk Documentation – daily wage calculator

Generated on: 2025-12-28

## Feature Overview (From Zendesk articles)
The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically calculates and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for the leave policy type (calendar days or working days) and automatically deducts public holidays from working days. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system creates an automatic pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table.

## Observed Jobs To Be Done
- Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay [Articles: 14244040988689]
- To adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Primary Personas
- HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction settings [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Navigation Paths
- Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave option [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Prerequisites
- An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee; the leave policy type (calendar days or working days) must be configured. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays from working days calculations. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Super admin role and access to payroll settings; existing leave types and salary component structure in the system [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Access to Leave Settings and ability to add or modify leave policies as a Super Admin [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Super admin access to payroll settings; payroll system must be configured [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Required Inputs
- Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of public holidays in the month, approved unpaid leave days. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only). [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days) [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Expected Outputs
- Automatic pay deduction reflected on the payroll table; calculated daily pay rate for unpaid leave deduction purposes. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method that applies daily deductions to monthly employee payroll [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Procedures
- Receive unpaid leave request; approve leave request; determine leave policy type (calendar or working days); calculate total working days in the month; subtract public holidays from working days; calculate daily pay rate by dividing salary by actual working days; generate automatic payroll deduction. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- 1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations. 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten. [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days) [Articles: 14244040988689]
- 1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and resave the new proration settings [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Rules / Limitations / Constraints
- Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days. The leave policy can use either calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month, e.g., 31 for January, 28 for February), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). Only Superadmin, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select the calculation base. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Salary component selection limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection limited to three options: Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Configuration applies to individual leave types for end-of-service calculations. [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected when configuring the policy [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Changes to salary proration affect all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Edge Cases & Warnings
- Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working policy, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days, not 22 days. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calculation results vary depending on the month length when using calendar days, and different calculation methods (calendar days vs. working days vs. custom days) can significantly impact final wage calculations. Companies must ensure their chosen method aligns with applicable labor laws. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration, allowing them to review potential impacts before finalizing settings [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days), requiring careful selection based on organizational policy [Articles: 14244040988689]
- When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject existing transactions and resave proration settings to apply changes [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Feature Interactions / Dependencies
- Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; integrates with leave management system for unpaid leave request approval; connects with employee record systems to access salary information. [Articles: 14154746403601]
- The Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service payroll processing [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Interacts with the payroll system to apply calculated daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; related to Leave Policies and Leave Settings configuration [Articles: 14244040988689]
- Interacts with Payroll system, payroll table transactions, and affects employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Glossary Terms
- Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days: A leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month). Working days: A leave policy based on working days (e.g., 22 working days per month). [Articles: 14154746403601]
- Calendar days: The number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: Only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: A flexible calculation base set by payroll table managers according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law. [Articles: 14243704039185]
- Leave encashment: The conversion of unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: Final payroll settlement when an employee exits the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies. Salary components: Basic salary and allowances used in wage calculations. [Articles: 14243768433425]
- Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that does not receive compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily values; Leave Policies: Configuration settings that define how leave is managed; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type based on calendar dates; Working days: Day calculation type based on business working days; Custom days: Day calculation type based on custom-defined days [Articles: 14244040988689]
- DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): Feature for configuring salary proration calculation bases. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days [Articles: 14243760419089]

## Claims To Validate (Playwright-verifiable)
- **ZDS_001** | (navigation) | The daily wage calculator configuration is accessible by navigating to Settings menu | path: Settings | steps: Locate the main navigation menu → Click on Settings | expected: Settings page loads successfully | [Articles: 14244040988689]
